entry.title: Second Chances
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 26,190Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Bobby and Athena are just two people trying to put their lives back together while figuring out how to co-parent. What starts as a complicated plan to foster kids in need slowly turns into something much deeper. Through the ups and downs of heartbreak, healing, and raising children who‚Äôve been through so much, they find strength in each other. Over time, their partnership grows into love, and together, they build a story about family, trust, and second chances.

entry.title: The Price of Power
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 20,207Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 5

Summary: Athena Carter and Bobby Nash couldn‚Äôt be more different. She‚Äôs the disciplined ‚Äúgood girl‚Äù with her future mapped out, while he‚Äôs the dangerous bad boy with one foot in college and the other in the streets. When their worlds start to collide, what begins as a bitter rivalry quickly sparks into something deeper neither of them can ignore. But falling for Bobby means stepping into a world Athena never imagined, one ruled by loyalty and violence. That tested everything she thought she knew about herself. As sparks turn to fire, Athena must decide if love is worth the risk of losing everything.

entry.title: Evergrowing
entry.summary:
Author: starylighting

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 24,694Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 7

Summary: Athena and Bobby are learning that parenting doesn‚Äôt end when the kids turn eighteen. With three grown children and two still at home, Bobby and Athena find themselves navigating new challenges at every stage of life. Each child carries their own struggles, some spoken and some hidden, but together the family works through the ups and downs with love, patience, and resilience. At the heart of it all, they‚Äôre reminded that family is a bond that grows, shifts, and deepens, no matter how old the kids get.

entry.title: The Cost Of Loving You
entry.summary:
Author: Iceprincess96

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,783Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 38

Summary: Eddie thought that when he finally confessed his love to Buck, he had found his happy ending. But the universe seemed intent on testing him. Three months into their relationship, Buck breaks up with him over pancakes, leaving Eddie shattered. As Buck moves on and starts seeing someone new, Eddie spirals, hiding his heartbreak behind a fragile mask of friendship. When the weight of unspoken feelings finally cracks, both men are forced to confront the love, fear, and mistakes that kept them apart.With the 118 as witnesses, and Chris as the heart between them, Eddie and Buck must navigate heartbreak, trust, and the slow, painful road to redemption ‚Äî discovering that love can survive even when it‚Äôs broken.¬†Previous Title - Shattered and whole

entry.title: i wanna do bad things (with you)
entry.summary:
Author: Minalover

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 36,536Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 8

Summary: "The 118, the home base for the Nash Crime Family, is an old, blown-out fire station, in a part of Los Angeles not often visited by more reputable types. The windows are boarded up and blacked out and the garage doors attached to the bay are firmly affixed by chains and padlocks to iron rings embedded into the cement floor. They call it the 118 because that's the number on the outside of the building. Inside too, if you know where to look. Sometimes, Buck thinks about the firefighters who used to work here. Maybe they were a family too." Or: the 9-1-1 Mafia!AU

entry.title: lowkey (i need you to move)
entry.summary:
Author: popcorn_squirrel

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,374Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 19

Summary: As it turns out, Chris had been waiting for his dad to confirm they could stay in LA. ‚ÄúThis is home,‚Äù he‚Äôd stated simply. And that had been that. However, that left the Diaz boys with one tiny problem - their former house was currently occupied. Luckily for them, said occupant loved their company and welcomed them back home with open arms. There wasn‚Äôt much by way of discussion - Eddie had told Buck that he and Christopher were staying in LA, Buck showed Christopher that his room was ready and waiting for him, and they celebrated with an evening of pizza and video games. For a while, things were easy. Simple. Eddie was back at the 118, all of their belongings had been shipped over from El Paso, and the three of them developed a rhythm that made living together seamless. At some point along the way, though, something shifted. or; Eddie is in love with Buck. Buck is in love with Eddie. Neither knows how to deal with their current living situation, and instead of talking about it, things spiral out of control.
